title: So Repertoir wants to talk about Quinn in other threads...

replies.body:
Playing as Valor was really fun though. It felt unique.

Now he pretty much drags his woman around the map like a taxi.

Yeah, I always considered Quinn to be 'Quinn (& Valor)' with Quinn being an abbreviated version for the sake of lack of space. Nowadays Quinn is Quinn, and Valor is all but completely non-existent.

Instead of committing to what Quinn & Valor should have been, they further removed Valor from Quinn's kit. They took SO MUCH from her kit just to allow Q to mark enemies with Harrier. Quinn needed bug fixes and a reward for Assassinating targets as Valor (literally reducing R cooldown if she got a kill would have been sufficient).

Which is exactly the problem. There is absolutely nothing in the ultimate that says teamwork to me, it say 'tool' or 'equipment'. Valor is being used for a purpose he isn't doing anything himself which is what made her kit feel fluid and fun in the first place, using him as transport implies he is subservient and lesser than Quinn when before he was capable of doing his own thing. The semi-randomness of Harrier and the risk of Tag Team fed into the whole 'stick to the plan, Val' kind of thing, he has personality and as such is not predictable and often disregards the plans Quinn made, with this ult he is apparently not only capable but willing to serve as transport for Quinn at a moments notice.

Also shouting 'NOW!' was cool back when it was instant and powerful, now it just feels....anticlimactic.

> [{quoted}](name=A Blue Quaker,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0IqHif0z,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2016-02-07T09:37:32.551+0000)
>
> Instead of committing to what Quinn & Valor should have been, they further removed Valor from Quinn's kit. They took SO MUCH from her kit just to allow Q to mark enemies with Harrier. Quinn needed bug fixes and a reward for Assassinating targets as Valor (literally reducing R cooldown if she got a kill would have been sufficient).

Problem is, they already reverted that change to her Q shortly after they added it, didn't compensate her for the nerfs they already made, then nerfed her even more.  This is all typical Rito behavior, so it was to be expected.
I don't believe her Q is nerfed at all over 5.22, the high base scaling+more Harrier damage+CC is definitely superior to Q doing more damage sometimes if they were low enough.

> [{quoted}](name=Quinn and Valet,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0IqHif0z,comment-id=000a00000000,timestamp=2016-02-07T10:05:23.778+0000)
>
> I don't believe her Q is nerfed at all over 5.22, the high base scaling+more Harrier damage+CC is definitely superior to Q doing more damage sometimes if they were low enough.

From my experience her damage, especially burst, is phenominal, and her Q blind is incredibly strong! she really doesnt need buffs atm imo, if anything i think her mobility niche is possibly a bit too strong, or rather available, as her ability to pick off squishies is incredible (that might just be me hating on assassins, and now that i think about it, shes really more an assassin than adc...

@Repertoir - Just to continue on from our conversation in the last thread:

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wUAfMkz5,comment-id=00090001000000000001000200000000,timestamp=2016-02-07T03:20:22.466+0000)Visually, not necessarily. If that question is slightly adjusted into "Did Quinn's new strategic identity necessitate the removal of Valor's burst capabilities?" then the answer is yes.

If this is the case, why not give Valor a new reason to fight rather than just pure burst, since that's problematic on a zero-cooldown ability? 

Or perhaps the burst damage could be made conditional somehow so that the low cooldown of the ability is offset by the difficulty involved in pulling off the burst. I'm just spitballing ideas/picking at your brain a bit because a lot of us Quinn players, while happy that she's doing well, feel the sore loss of Valor's combat which was really important to her kit. 

P.S. I made a thread about Quinn's rework last month, it's rather long but has a TL;DR at the bottom that sums up my thoughts: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/UH6F7HNR-riotrepertoir-and-others-about-the-quinn-valor-rework

I am sorry but valor was unhealthy and lacked in counterplay when ahead she could assassin someone with about as much counterplay as rengar, I played her I know full well of how she was capable of it, this lack of counterplay is why her ult was gated by one of the longest non-global ults in game which really reduced her reliability, furthering her into a fest or famine state because without it her ult would become too oppressive.  

The rework completely addressed the unhealthy part and emphasized the movement and roaming ability of her ult. Which is what her ult tried to be about from the beginning but was overshadowed by the burst potential. 

Final Quinn & Valor are a **team ** Valor fighting while Quinn did literally nothing until the end of the ult was the complete opposite of teamwork, which to me went against her identity a lot, short of making her a true form swapper I don't think they could have realistically made a good way to fight as valor because valor would need a different kit so that Quinn would do something in to keep their teamwork in place while fighting as valor.

Compared to the rework every thing is about the team work between Quinn & Valor.

Here's what Valor did in the old kit: Marked targets for her passive, helped out for her Q, did basically everything for her ult.

Here's what Valor does in her new kit: Marked targets for her passive, helped out for her Q, and carries Quinn around for her ult.

Valor does significantly less stuff now. I'm not really sure why you think him carrying Quinn around is somehow more 'teamwork' then actively fighting on his own. If you think her old ult was focused too much on Valor, wouldn't it make sense for her new ult to be focused too much on Quinn? 

(and if Valor was unhealthy and lacked in counterplay, then basically every single assassin is. Which, you know, I wouldn't argue with, but...)

> did basically everything for her ult.
> I'm not really sure why you think him carrying Quinn around is somehow more 'teamwork' then actively fighting on his own. 

This was the problem Quinn stopped existing during the ult until skystrike she did **nothing **to assist while you played as Valor **alone** by himself as it was valor blinded, valor jumped, and valor got vision there was no team anymore it was all valor, which went against their teamwork theme heavily, imo. It would take a much larger scale rework to actually make Valor work with Quinn during the valor mode for it, while with the rework valor literally helps Quinn in every single ability, sure it would be nice for Quinn to be able to help valor playing as valor as well, but that was beyond the scoop or scale of this especially when Valor's "kit" simply mirrored Quinns without any teamwork. (I am not opposed to such a potential just pointing out why it wasn't done)

Also you forgot Valor grants Quinn vision from the sky with W. 

>(and if Valor was unhealthy and lacked in counterplay, then basically every single assassin is. Which, you know, I wouldn't argue with, but...)

I know off hand riot considers quite a few assassins unhealthy due to extremely low counterplay issues mostly notably... {{champion:107}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:91}} being the biggest offenders.

Quinn and Valor may be a duo that works together, but that doesn't mean every ability in Quinn's kit needs to be strictly about teamwork. 

Regarding your comments about her old ultimate, I think it made sense for Quinn to leave the scene for a while as Valor was in combat; how's she going to take the time to charge a move as large in scale as Skystrike otherwise?

>Quinn and Valor may be a duo that works together, but that doesn't mean every ability in Quinn's kit needs to be strictly about teamwork. 

I didn't like zero teamwork in the ult is all, it doesn't have to be as high as Quinn mode shows with near every ability but it needed **something** to retain the theme at all.

>Regarding your comments about her old ultimate, I think it made sense for Quinn to leave the scene for a while as Valor was in combat; how's she going to take the time to charge a move as large in scale as Skystrike otherwise?

Skystrike didn't do that much damage that it needs 20 seconds to charge :p, she could something before the end of it.

Well, my interpretation of Quinn's old ultimate was that she'd send Valor after someone she wouldn't be able to catch up to and kill otherwise; and if that's not teamwork, then I don't know what is -- without Valor, Quinn wouldn't be able to reliably pin down fleeing prey, and without Quinn, Valor wouldn't really have any targets to begin with.

Either way, in-game abilities aren't always going to make perfect sense or be realistic. Like I mentioned in another post, just because Tahm can ult on land in-game doesn't mean he can do the same in the story; obviously, we're expected to assume it's something he's able to perform only in a body of water... some abilities simply require suspension of disbelief. Likewise, just because Quinn disappears in game for Valor to take over, doesn't mean this actually occurs lorewise, or that they're not actually fighting as a team.

This is exactly my interpretation of Tag Team. You send your falcon to go hunt down wounded prey, it's literally a thing Falconer's do. She send Valor to hunt them down while she follows behind, sneaking through trees/bushes/whatever then when the time is right she strikes with a hail of bolts to finish them off. Does Elise rappel to thin air in lore? Of course she doesn't but there's nowhere for he to rappel on the rift so that's how it happens, the things champions do in game are supposed to be things they can do outside of it adapted for the limitations of the game/rift, so I can accept Tag Team but I cannot accept Valor carrying her because nowhere is it even implied that Demacian Eagles are anything more than a rare and powerful /bird/, he cannot carry her and still fly it's simply absurd, she must weigh up to 5x more than him in full armour.
The funniy thing is the size increase Valor gets when using ult compared to when you recall or send Valor out to gouge peeps eyes out.
For best results, obtain Baron or Herald Buff then recall mid ult.

Yes, Quinn was completely uninvolved with the old ult apart from skystrike. But you play as her for the rest of the game; if I have to choose which one of the two to have overfocus  in the ult, I'm going to choose the one that isn't all that focused on otherwise.
yes you play as quinn for 20 mins but the 30 seconds quinn goes on vacation is when everyone want to look for her

Valor had much more counterplay than Rengar or Talon, his speed is immediately denied if hit by anything, he doesn't have stealth, his dash isn't particularly fast or long ranged and thus can be interrupted by anyone who can, blind is the kind of CC that keeps Valor safe as it still allows people to use abilities to escape him it just means that autoattack reliant champions can't murder him during the time for the purposes of being an assassin it's objectively a shitty version of dodge that can be cleansed.

The assassins you list either have escapes or a way to survive retaliation(Battle Roar) while Valor only has blind and the target of that is either dead or you failed anyway. Assassination was not a role it was an option, you could not Rengar people as Valor unless your were significantly ahead, in an even environment it was more a way to engage a duel with someone by securing your blind and ability damage on them and finishing them off with Quinn. On the flip side you could whittle people down as Quinn and send Valor in to finish the job, it's all teamwork just not in the 'well they both do something in this ability' way. 

You don't need to have equal representation in the kit to be considered a team, a pair of hunters who's skills complement each other and help one another finish off prey is just as much of a team as what Nidalee would be if the cat was her partner and not an alternate form.

"Here's what Valor did in the old kit: Marked targets for her passive, helped out for her Q, did basically everything for her ult.

Here's what Valor does in her new kit: Marked targets for her passive, helped out for her Q, and carries Quinn around for her ult."

You're comparing what Valor did then and now when the point was about how much they did together. Previously they did her passive and Q together. Now they do her passive, Q, and ult together, at least visually. Play wise it doesn't matter because you weren't really transforming into valor gameplay wise before, you just became fast and melee Quinn that looked like Valor.

Being unhealthy and lacking counterplay isn't essential to Valor's identity though, meaning Tag Team was something that could've been tuned and balanced accordingly rather than removed entirely if lack of counterplay was the issue. Honestly, I think Quinn becoming a true transformation Champion as you suggested would have been cool and in the spirit of her identity (and it certainly was something that has been considered by Riot but put aside for unknown reasons, possibly related to resource limitations); perhaps Valor could have had some if not all of the mobility he has today while losing it in combat so that the ult has counterplay identical to its current iteration. That way, Quinn and Valor could retain their identity as strong roamers while also being playable as a duo.

Trinity force and AD build and BotRK to one shot carries.

Phreak must have thought up the champ so he can say "Tons of Damage" a lot XD

So I really want to address this issue with saying that 'there was no reason for Valor to stay, he was just fast melee Quinn' does that mean that we can expect Shyvanna's ult to go? After all it's just tankier AoE Shyvanna, right? The issue with that is the same issue Quinn has now, it ruins the fluidity of the champion's kit because their kit was made with that in mind. Quinn just simply doesn't feel as good to play, the bug fixes in many ways draw your attention away from what was lost to get them and it took a few patches for me to realise it myself but really Quinn relied a lot on the instant MS from Tag Team for a large number of things not least of which escaping.

I appreciate everything Repertoir did for us during the update and we were lucky to have him but I still can't forgive the lack of communication prior, I know several of us made attempts to show Riot how we felt about Quinn with quite thought out threads and I know he read them because he commented in some yet seemingly none of that was taken into account until after the announcement when it was too late to make drastic changes. I understand that she's seeing competitive play and that her pick rate is up but I don't really think that it's going to be a long term thing, somewhere down the line a meta-shift or a nerf is going to put an end to that because that level of mobility will need curbing eventually(just ask Kassadin) and all of that will go away but not even her old playerbase will still play her. I really genuinely feel like he traded her theme and feel for viability and to me that's just unacceptable and I can't bring myself to be content with that outcome, she feels shallow and uninteresting by comparison to her previous state and I really sincerely wish they had just tried making the Harrier and Vault fixes happen in any of the 3 year period since her damn release so we could actually see if her old kit was fundamentally flawed or if it was just the myriad of technical problems holding her back.


To address more of what Repertoir has said: You can say that you don't think she was good at something, you are entitled to believe that but honestly can you say that the current form of the champion is healthy? Is she not still useless when behind? Is she not still a lane bully with token assassin elements who's only utility is a blind? If these were your problems with the old Quinn when why did you address none of them? Who did this rework serve, Repertoir? The way I see it more people than ever are extremely annoyed and frustrated when playing against Quinn and with her pick rate up they're feeling that in more games and a significant amount of her core playerbase enjoys playing her a lot less, so who benefited from this update? Competitive play maybe? I guess that's true but that's not going to be the case forever, she has a niche role that is meta dependant so when she's no longer picked there then who's enjoying playing her?


Unfortunately we live in a world where this ult exists and isn't going away any time in the next year or two or maybe ever so if I may offer some actual feedback: You know me, I want more damage on Harrier and less on Q, the Q damage for the CC it provides is just plain stupid but when I say Harrier damage I mean scaling as in I feel that her Harriers should be scaling up to 75% of AD instead of 50% and if you could stop being misleading in the tooltip and including the damage from the auto in Harrier's damage so that it looks higher that'd be great too. Ult could seriously use some kind of CD because mana gating doesn't work past level 11 which is when her mobility becomes abusable and is usually the first time in the game pro players make use of it for things other then getting back to lane, so either her level 1 ult is terrible or... well actually paying a quarter mana for basically Strut does seem kind of bad(At level 6 ulting grants about 130 MS).



TL;DR: I'm upset.

My only concern for Quinn is that her ult looks so SO derpy :S I mean, we know valor is NOT that big, plus she's literally hanging, she looks as if a predator bird was about to take her away... I think Riot could have done a better job at the animation, couldn't she just run with valor by her side or front? maybe give her increase sight now that you're at it, or maybe she could actually ride on top of valor since he's gigantic now and she can't really fight, make her look like freaking Nausicaa of the wind valley, not a kidnapped baby: http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KidnappingBirdOfPrey

hello! not that hard? http://images6.fanpop.com/image/photos/33400000/Nausicaa-nausicaa-of-the-valley-of-the-wind-33442105-1600-1200.jpg
Look at the splash art, he's massive. With her current emotes its literally impossible to increase his size without making the model look weird.

well you're right that her splash makes valor look big, though I was based mostly on the valor that was playable before she was changed, he wasn't really that big and that might have been a mistake on Riot's end.

I feel like he's supposed to be fairly big, Demacian eagles are rare and he's the only one left. I don't imagine a small sized eagle would be fighting other champions and actually inflicting damage pre-rework, or being able to carry Quinn. This is a game though after all and we can't be so nit-picky.

Valor is definitely huge, his size is downplayed in the emotes and abilities purely so that he doesn't clutter the screen. That being said at no point are we given to believe that Valor is at all a supernatural being or anything other than a rare and huge bird, he cannot pick up and carry a fully grown woman from the floor and fly around, game mechanics don't have to make sense but in this game they reflect the actual abilities of the champions and to imply that he could do that out of game just doesn't add up.

I really think her new ult is incredibly lazy, Skystrike makes no sense anymore as Q&V somehow rain arrows down from above while only gliding along the ground. They just snipped and pasted shit back together instead of making a full effort to ensure everything is still coherent.

Honestly people are being pretty anal about the Quinn Changes. Functionally, every single element of Quinn's Kit reinforces her partnership with Valor. Valor marks, Valor blinds, Valor scouts, heck now Valor even carries (literally). Valor is a very clear a present force in all her abilities. 

My one complaint is that the channeling for Beyond-Enemy-Lines is mad clunky. I kind of wish it was more like charging Vi's Q or Xerath's Q. Maybe even punish Quinn harder when the channel gets channeled as a result?

Presence in abilities does not necessarily mean teamwork, the only ability that feels like teamwork at the moment is Harrier as it's Quinn and Valor working together to do something. Valor blinding people is to an extent too as he's giving Quinn an opening to attack or escape/trick people it's mostly the animation that bothers most people about that as it looks like she's literally throwing him.

Her ult isn't teamwork it's Valor being used as a tool to achieve something, he picks her up and carries her around but leaves her for dead as soon as shit gets real while Quinn's only input in the ability is summoning a burst of arrows from the aether despite never actually raising her bow. It's a clunky mess as far as visual and thematic design is concerned and really doesn't fit the characters at all.

You mention "Harrier" as the only moment their working together. 2/3 of her basic abilities trigger Harrier and the last ability improves its effectiveness. I just think that deserves mentioning. Not trying to be a prick, I agree its very integral and its demonstrative of them working together to achieve something. I really think its for a lack of imagination that people are shouting to say "their thematic isn't represented in their gameplay". The reworked Quinn delivers much better on "resourceful scout/falconer" , I feel clever when dueling with Quinn, I feel like I have a lot more reach/tactical options with the reworked ult. I feel like I still have the damage I need to assassinate .

Assassinating people is as much about positioning as it is about damage and that's where Quinn fall flat, she has to attack from range because she has no true gap closers which means that there is a myriad of things people can do to stop her, especially with team-mates around. If this had the visuals of the old ult I may agree, she could use her companion to scout around but being a bird he's not good at taking hits so he has to get out if he takes damage. Being carried around by him doesn't fit her theme, it's the visual effects of the ult that clash, not the mechanics. 

I really don't know why they couldn't have adapted the old PBE thing to work with this update, where Tag Team had a much lower CD but no Skystrike, without the execute damage Valor wouldn't be able to outright assassinate people so it solves that problem, people still get to play as Valor and they're a highly mobile team albeit with a short CD. Everybody wins.

> [{quoted}](name=Quinn and Valet,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0IqHif0z,comment-id=0010000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-09T13:09:55.642+0000)I really don't know why they couldn't have adapted the old PBE thing to work with this update, where Tag Team had a much lower CD but no Skystrike, without the execute damage Valor wouldn't be able to outright assassinate people so it solves that problem, people still get to play as Valor and they're a highly mobile team albeit with a short CD. Everybody wins.

I thought this would have been really cool too, although I'm not entirely sure why those changes involved a CD refresh to her W upon every cast of Tag Team--I guess it was to emphasize her scouting ability? Either way, as per Repertoir, it seems like a  100% uptime on Valor would provide too much burst on demand--even with the loss of her execute considered, probably--so if he were to ever return as a playable character, he'd need a reason to be played besides burst, assuming the ultimate remains at zero cooldown. 

**Edit:** Honestly, I think turning him into a pure scout and sticky melee fighter would be enough, while reusing his old abilities, because even if it comes at the cost of losing Harrier damage, you can get a guaranteed Q off on your opponent if you E->Q successively. But I know that may be confusing and/or unrewarding gameplay for the Champion that could leave something else to be desired, especially if he doesn't retain the same burst as before and if Q is left as an ability that reduces sight to melee range, which wouldn't really help Valor at all. So if that's the case, then he'd just need a new kit; or at least, versions of Quinn's abilities that make sense for him.

I'm not convinced to be honest, Valor's burst without Skystrike was extremely limited and unlike similar champions like Master Yi he didn't have untargetability, Meditate or Slow Immunity to survive retaliation so I don't think that it's really a viable argument to claim that Valor had too much burst inherently.
Anyone committed to their favorite Champion is going to be meticulous about an undesirable update to their character, especially if it removes a core aspect of their kit/theme.

Firstly, your quotes are borken in the OP (dunno why this happens, but it happens to me too when I use quotes to Format) :P

Second, when it comes to Quinn's (and Valor's) old ultimate, we need to accept that there's a really good chance it's not coming back. We can debate if this was, or wasn't, the right decision at the time, or even now, but in the end, that's all for nothing. This in mind, we, as Quinn and Valor players, need to aim our feedback at improving what we have now.

Building off what some others have discussed here a little, I'm going to mention Kindred for a second. While you play primarily as Lamb, a few things about the champion makes Wolf feel as much a part of Kindred as Lamb, these include: 

* Wolf's constant visual presence
* Dialog between Wolf and Lamb reinforces the idea that they're partners.

While it seems like a short list, this is really all that's needed to achieve the "partnership" feeling those two gain (though some could consider it a shallow relationship in Kindred's case, it's a step in the right direction in the end). 

So how do we achieve this with Quinn and Valor? Firstly, we need Valor to be a constant visual presence on the map. Valor should be following Quinn along as she moves, swooping from perch to perch as he does so. Possibly add an energy bar to Valor to limit the number of actions he can perform within a certain amount of time (meaning the champion's cooldowns would be fairly low as a general rule, but Valor can tire quickly making management of his energy important). You can achieve some cool things with Quinn's abilities by doing this:

* **Harrier (Passive)** - Valor swooping down to mark the "vulnerable" target, allowing both sides to predict the marking of targets, and making Valor more visually impactful part of the champion without actually increasing power level would be an interesting way to make him a real part of the champion.

* **Aerial Assault (Q)** - Can be based on Valor's current location when cast, lending importance to Valor's current position for both player and opponent.

* **Heightened Senses (W)** - Could be a channeled effect of sorts, causing Valor to circle around Quinn, revealing terrain he passes over (he'd probably grant vision passively, being a part of the champion, the spell would just move him around). Canceling the channel will have him roost on the nearest wall, allowing the player to have some control over Valor's position in the map without playing _as_ Valor directly. Possibly tie Valor's maximum energy, or energy regeneration rate, to this skill.

* **Vault (E)** - While Valor doesn't directly participate in the functionality of the spell, he does mark Vault's target with Harrier, so Valor could, visually, swoop down and "strike" the target visually at the same moment Quinn does, further reinforcing their partnership through the extreme coordination required to pull such a thing off.

* **Behind Enemy Lines (R)** - I don't think that Valor should be able to indefinitely carry Quinn, unless Demacian Eagles are deceptively powerful (which raises the question, among others, why did they go extinct?), it's physically not possible for Valor to carry Quinn for very long, if at all. The action should be the epitome of Quinn and Valor's coordination and partnership, everything must be perfectly done by both parties to make it work in a combat situation.
 - Under the limited duration system provided by Valor's energy limit, we can remove the "channel" time of the skill. Quinn can call to Valor for aid, run around a bit, and then jump into the air to be caught by Valor, and off they go. It shouldn't be true flight, but more a series of hops on Quinn's part, with Valor increasing the distance she's able to bound. By involving Quinn in this process, it becomes clear that Valor is not doing all the work, and thus not a tool, but a partner.
 - Activating Heightened Senses could allow Quinn and Valor to pass over walls while under this effect (accentuated by Quinn kicking off of said terrain to give Valor a hand), but costing a massive amount of Valor's energy to execute, so maintaining this effect for very long should be extremely taxing, allowing them to go over one wall easily, and two walls if timed extremely well. Ending the effect while over terrain could cause Quinn to perform a sort of sliding animation to the nearest side of the terrain.
 - There are more technical that could be explored here, however the last thing I want to touch on is Skystrike. The ability is really rather useless in most situations, and I personally use it more for wave-clear than anything else. If it's kept, I'd like to see it change a little, requiring Valor to have a certain amount of energy available, letting him pull Quinn to the height needed to perform Skystrike. 


So the abilities are out of the way, providing Valor with a consistent presence within the game, what about voice lines? Quinn and Valor can't interact in the way that Wolf and Lamb do, as they have a language barrier of sorts. Instead, Valor needs to be able to give simple squawks of acknowledgement to Quinn's lines, and Quinn needs to react to Valor's actions as he moves around (Valor marks a target with harrier? "Stick to the plan Val..."). More interactions based on the actions of one character or the other reinforces the fascinating relationship the two share.

I feel like a lot of these visuals would be there if she was released today but she really was a victim of her rushed development. Vault is almost there, he strikes the target at the same time it's just that he sorta....teleports, I think that Vault could use some love though it got a lot of nice consistency updates but with the mark it applies weaker and the nerf to the slow it feels much worse to use then it used to, Vault was a nice Risk vs Reward spell as it was your only gap opener and it put you in a vulnerable position something that could work could be enhancing it's effect when used at range. Vault works differently when cast close and when cast far, so it's not a big stretch to say that if you use it to close the gap that it could have a bit more punch possibly in the CC department?

All this talk of energy and the ultimate has reminded me on an idea I had and some way to improve on it. I talked once about giving it a short CD but making it function similar to Blitz ult, where the ult has a passive that is disabled when on CD. What this could become is that ranking the ult increases the effect Valor has on Quinn's basic abilities, stronger harriers, better slow on vault or whatever but when inside the ult you drain his energy and disable it as he has to recover from hauling her fat ass around the place. See Riot seems to want Quinn's ult to have no CD and that's annoying because it makes it a nightmare to balance but if we assume that's always going to be the compromise we could instead go with her ult can be used without CD but you only get the benefit of the passive if you don't use it for a certain time.

That's just an idea I had when I read this so don't dwell too heavily on it, I just feel like if all Quinn can be good at is mobility that eventually it's going to a problem if she's nerfed or a meta shift makes that less viable because she has nothing else going on in her kit. There needs to be a way that we can balance the mobility without hurting her power too much and I think that rewarding her for not using it could be a good way to do it, or even make it like Kassadin where consecutive casts 'wear out' Valor so it costs more, takes longer to channel, is slower, ect and reduce the penalties already in place.

It's been extremely difficult to articulate my thoughts on the subject, and I'm wary to speak on balance in detail due to the highly speculative nature of the subject.

I do not completely agree that investing skill points into the ultimate should improve the effectiveness of the other abilities, as it provides fairly irregular power spikes, and this effect can be achieved through regular scaling on her abilities. In the case of Vault, the slow could probably increase in strength as you level the skill up and still be acceptable without tying it to her Ultimate, and for Harrier a regular level scaling would be more consistent than ult rank based systems would be.

It would probably be more engaging for both the player and opponent if Valor's energy was a constant management challenge as well, rather than only being used during the ultimate, as giving it relevancy outside of her mobility is the whole idea behind the energy bar in the first place.

I feel as though Quinn and Valor's focus should be mostly on Mobility and mostly front loaded Damage, as per her theme as a character, with a minor facet being her vision provision via W.

Giving Valor an Energy resource to manage, on top of Quinn's existing Mana pool, is going to be the hardest sell for this idea. This has never been done in League before, a single "champion" managing both Energy and Mana at the same time, and while I think that Quinn and Valor would be perfect to try this out, I don't think many people would be excited to see their favorite champion be turned into a testing dummy for new ideas, and this will be the biggest hurtle to overcome with this idea. 

I do feel, however, that if done well, this system would accurately convey the feeling of two separate characters within the same Champion.

I feel the below is a relevant example of what I'm trying to get at, though I couldn't find a good place to wedge it into the primary topic

> Valor has 300 total energy.
> 
> * **Harrier **- Small but important cost to mark targets. Say 50 Energy.
> * **Aerial Assault **- Small cost to cast on Valor's part, once again 50 Energy, however when combined with Harrier it costs 100 Energy. If you only have the 50 to cast this spell, all you get is the blinding effect on the primary target, and the AoE damage provided.
> * **Heightened Senses **- Flat drain on energy each second. Have this energy drain per second reduce with rank, becoming largely sustainable in the later ranks, providing strong vision abilities later in the game to hone in on that scout fantasy the pair is centered on. It should be used as a tool to reposition Valor, allowing you all but full control over him as a character in the game.
> * **Vault **- Small energy cost, if any, to Valor. This ability is mostly on Quinn, so it shouldn't really be on Valor to foot the bill for it. The only cost Valor needs to worry about is the Harrier mark. 
> * **Behind Enemy Lines** - Exponential energy cost that increases drastically with each passing second, reducing with rank, allowing Quinn to travel greater distances on the same amount of energy as the game progresses. Obviously, having Heightened Senses active during this will rapidly deplete your energy, but allowing you to pass over walls while both are active really focuses on the mobility they sport.
